author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: وَعِزَّتِكَ لا أُرِيْدُ مِنَ النَّوْمِ وَلا مِنَ اليَقْظَةِ إِلاَّ ما أَنْتَ تُرِيْدُ، أَنَا عَبْدُكَ وَفِي قَبْضَتِكَ أَيِّدْنِيْ عَلَى ما يَتَضَوَّعُ بِهِ عَرْفُ رِضائِكَ، هذا أَمَلِي وَأَمَلُ المُقَرَّبِيْنَ الحَمْدُ لَكَ يا إِلهَ العالَمِيْنَ.
translation: By Thy might! I ask not, whether sleeping or waking, but that which Thou dost desire. I am Thy servant and in Thy hands. Do Thou graciously aid me to do what will shed forth the fragrance of Thy good pleasure. This, truly, is my hope and the hope of them that enjoy near access to Thee. Praised be Thou, O Lord of the worlds!
